themes: uncertainty in future funding and program eligibility
risk of losing staff positions and spaces
need for operational support for nonprofits with venues
balancing art quality with support for at-risk communities
importance of supporting educational and artist service organizations
measuring impact on tourism and communities
key_phrases: deeply concerned that we are hiring staff, building out spaces, and expanding programing that may ultimately have funding reduced or eliminated
so much uncertainty about how much funding will be available in the future
Will we have to eliminate the positions or abandon the spaces when we no longer have this generous city support?
How do we plan seasons of work when we don't know what program we will qualify for and if we will make the cut for the 30 orgs that will get Thrive?
Can we graduate from Thrive and still be funded at a reasonable level?
Can we add a supplement to support non-profits with venues cover their utility bills and maintenance?
How do we center the quality of the art in addition to the at-risk of erasure communities?
Educational and artist service organizations deserve financial support even though they do not target tourists.
barriers_identified: potential loss of staff positions and spaces due to funding cuts
lack of operational support for nonprofits with venues
difficulty planning due to unclear program eligibility
limited support for organizations not focused on tourism
solutions_proposed: add a supplement to support non-profits with venues cover their utility bills and maintenance
measure the impact to tourism and communities
continue financial support for educational and artist service organizations even if they do not target tourists
